intro: Codonopsis limprichtii, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Codonopsis limprichtii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional Chinese medicine.
